author: protolambda
content:
For anyone wondering about pyrmont participation rate changes today:
- Just went through some EF lighthouse and EF nimbus pyrmont updates, they were offline earlier today.
- We hit a validator DB migration issue on dev/experimental version of prysm a while back. Looking at ways to restart them, and resolve validator performance issues with latest experimental (!) changes (we run a good amount, stressing the old prysm slashing protection db code). This amounts to about 4 - 5% of pyrmont validators.
- I have not updated EF Teku yet, but it's running very stable (at a little higher memory though). Will update for the latest improvements after resolving prysm update.

author: ajsutton
content: I switched a couple of our nodes over to using the dependent root field added to the standard API just before mainnet within the validator to detect when duties need to be recalculated instead of depending on reorg events.  They're performing exactly as well as all our other nodes which is nice.  Will be doing an update to all nodes at some point today.
